title: Front Fork - Disassembly

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.

Do not change the fork adjustment settings. If they are changed, this will change the handling of the motorcycle from those which the rider is used to. Riding with unfamiliar fork settings may cause unexpected handling characteristics leading to loss of control and an accident.
Fork Disassembly - CB7; CN7; CS7; CE7
Fork Spring and Top Cap Removal
Never tightly clamp the outer tube as this will cause the tube to permanently distort. A distorted tube is not serviceable and must be replaced.
in a vice and mount the fork vertically in the service tool.
Unscrew the top cap until it is released from the fork outer tube.
The preload spacer seat, preload spacer and the spring can fall out of the fork when you invert the fork in the stage that follows.
Holding the fork inner and outer tubes together, invert the fork and pour out the fork oil into a suitable container. Pump the damper rod to remove all of the oil.
Allow the outer tube to slide down the inner to allow access to the spring spacer.

While compressing the fork spring and while the spring holder is in place always wear protective equipment for the face and eyes and never stand directly above or look directly down on the fork. If the spring compressor or holder should dislodge or detach, the resulting release of spring tension could cause parts to fly off resulting in injury to the user.
over the top cap. Position the two adjustable arms to the holes in the spring spacer. Screw in the arms until they positively engage in the spring spacer holes.
, manually compress the fork spring and insert the spring holder as shown, below the damper locknut.
Loosen the lock nut for the top cap a small amount.
Carefully count the number of turns necessary and unscrew the top cap until the top cap is released from the damper.
Keep the top cap and damping adjuster rod assembly aligned with the fork tube to prevent damage to the adjuster rod during the stage that follows.
Remove the top cap and damping adjuster rod assembly.
Compress the fork spring again and remove the spring holder and
Remove the bump rubber (if not attached), nylon spacer, spring spacer and spring.
Fork Seal and Bearing Bush Removal
Invert the fork assembly and mount it in
Raise the inner tube and remove the dust seal from the outer tube.

and, using a slide hammer action to release the oil seal and bushes from the outer tube. Separate the inner and outer tubes, leaving the seals and bushes in place on the inner tube. Note the relative positions and orientation of all bushes and seals before removal.
